response.overview: When King Kong was popular in the 1930s, it got parodied in cartoons, such as Pooch the Pup, Betty Boop, Mickey Mouse, or Looney Tunes. What if Charley Bowers, Hal Roach made a short subject that spoofed it. What if there was a parody that starred Laurel and Hardy, The Three Stooges, or The Marx Brothers? What if Tex Avery, Chuck Jones, Bob Clampett, Friz Freleng, or Robert McKimson lampooned King Kong? Well, it would look like the film you are going to watch right now. From 1975, this is "Walking Small" a 16mm student film by Richard Cobb.
response.title: Walking Small
